title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, June 22, 1864
summary: Nadenbousch writes his wife that business is slow, and he is thinking about shutting down. He discusses his health, his loneliness, his desire to come home, and mutual friends. He sends messages for his children, and gives news of recent battles and casualties.
keywords: Death/Casualties, Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
